title: The Pentagon: Built in 16 Months
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Pentagon: Built in 16 Months.

hook.text: The Pentagon is the world's largest office building â€” 6.5 million square feet, built in just 16 months.

buildup.text: Constructed during World War II, it housed 26,000 workers and had its own bus station and shopping mall.

discovery.text: Its five-sided shape was dictated by the original plot's boundaries, not military symbolism.

twist.text: The building was placed across the river from D.C. to avoid worsening the capital's housing shortage.

climax.text: Wartime urgency proved that massive construction is possible when bureaucracy steps aside.

punchline.text: War built the world's biggest office in 16 months.

quiz.question: Why is the Pentagon shaped with five sides?
